Package io.frictionlessdata.tableschema.tabledatasource

Interface TableDataSource

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractTableDataSource, BeanTableDataSource, CsvTableDataSource, JsonArrayTableDataSource, StringArrayTableDataSource
public interface TableDataSource
Interface defining the structure holding data for a Table. Concrete implementations implement this interface to provide ways for creating a Table on
  • JSON-encoded array data
  • CSV-encoded data
  • String arrays
This class and its subclasses will strip Unicode BOMs from the input data

    Data format, currently either CSV or JSON.

    • iterator

      Iterator<String[]> iterator()

    • getHeaders

      Returns the data headers if no headers were set or the set headers
      Returns:
      Column headers as a String array

    • getDataAsStringArray

      List<String[]> getDataAsStringArray() throws Exception
      Returns the whole data as a List of String arrays, each List entry is one row
      Returns:
      List containing the data
      Throws:
      Exception - thrown if reading the data fails

    • hasReliableHeaders

      boolean hasReliableHeaders()
      Signals whether extracted headers can be trusted (CSV with header row) or not (JSON array of JSON objects where null values are omitted).
      Returns:
      true if extracted headers can be trusted, false otherwise

    • readSkippingBOM

      static String readSkippingBOM(InputStream is)
      Use the ByteOrderMarkStrippingInputStream class to read from the provided InputStream and strip the BOM if found. Use the found BOM to determine the UTF dialect if any and read big/little endian conform
      Parameters:
      is - InputStream to read from
      Returns:
      Contents of the InputStream as a String

    • toSecure

      IOException

    • getDefaultEncoding

      static Charset getDefaultEncoding()
      Get the standard Charset (encoding) to use if none is specified. According to the Datapackage specs, this should not be the platform default, but UTF-8: "specify the character encoding of the resource’s data file. The values should be one of the “Preferred MIME Names” for a character encoding registered with IANA . If no value for this key is specified then the default is UTF-8." From: https://specs.frictionlessdata.io/data-resource/#metadata-properties We assume the same should apply for Tables.
      Returns:
      the default Charset
